description: Castle-like building, built in 1899 in the Romanesque Revival style, features a clock tower, "Friends of Old City Hall" exhibit and a War Memorial.

reviews.title: THANKFULLY NOT 'OUT WITH THE OLD, IN WITH THE NEW'
text: Its Romanesque Revival style gives this beautiful building its swagger. When the space age-looking modern City Hall became the home of the city's municipal government in 1965, Old City Hall was repurposed as court space for the better part of six decades. The clock tower soars 103.6 meters.

reviews.title: Cool at night
text: Very nice walk around during the night. Nice illumination and some art forms to discover and read about. For a nice short walk before getting dinner.

reviews.title: Beautiful exterior
text: We were only allowed to walk around the main floor which was interesting. The staff were very nice & answered my question about paranormal activities, saying they had heard about some things that were peculiar. The exterior is incredible to behold.

reviews.title: Grand historic building
text: The exterior of this grand historic building, constructed in Romanesque style in 1889 (completed in 1899), with a prominent clock tower, is impressive and one can spend a good deal of time admiring the details of its design. The building appeared to be locked, but we pushed open a heavy door to discover that it was indeed open. There were strict security procedures in order to enter, as the building now operates as a court house - the largest and busiest in all of Canada. The magnificent interior with its mosaic floor, columns, gargoyles, old elevator shaft, caricatures of Councillors, staircase and stained glass window was well worth a visit.

reviews.title: Beautiful Old Building
text: The Old City Hall is located in Nathan Phillips Square which is a major tourist location because of the TORONTO sign.
The Old City Hall is located on one side of the square and the newer city hall is on an adjacent side.
The old building is really lovely with some beautiful architecture which reminded me a bit of the nearby university of Toronto buildings.
Worth checking out if you admire architecture.

reviews.title: Gorgeous outside, didn't get in
text: Circumnavigate the building to look at all of the detail then rest on the front steps.  It has quite a story and is stunning to take in.

reviews.title: Great illumination
text: The old hall is superior to the new hall, especially if you see it at night. The building is beautifully illuminated. Access is convenient as there is a subway station within walking distance.

reviews.title: Must go
text: This is one of the main touristic points in Toronto. It is free and definitely worth stopping by and taking some pictures.

reviews.title: Beautiful
text: What a gorgeous building. Love the working clock chimes on the hour too. A lovely historical site right downtown in TO. Worthwhile.

reviews.title: Winter visit to Toronto
text: The old city Hall is one of the nicest landmark of the economic capital of Canada.
You will never get lost by using it as the center of your walks and strolls. Its belltower can be heard every hour, at night too, and is so nice to hear the bell!

reviews.title: Lots of people enjoying this area
text: We stopped here for pictures as did a lot of other people.  Our tour guide took us from here to the underground city which was a highlight of the trip.

reviews.title: Now a Court House
text: Free to wander round and explore this old building.  A nice piece of history.  It is now a court house so you must go through security checks to go in but well worth it to see part of the history of old Toronto.

reviews.title: Brilliant architecture
text: Situated next to new city hall, I would definitely say that in this case old is better. The building is wonderfully built with fantastic detail well worth a look.

reviews.title: The best of architecture
text: One of the best views of Toronto, the Old City Hall building combines the best of old architecture with modernity in the background. A building that impresses with grandeur and beauty.

reviews.title: Still Heading Bay Street
text: Old City Hall in Toronto is an impressive sandstone building whose clock tower dominates the horizon as you are coming up Bay Street from the lake. The building was built in the late 1800s and is actually Toronto's third city hall and will hopefully be turned into a heritage museum to display Toronto's history. The bells in the tower have been tolling since the turn of the century, but just recently the hourly chime has stopped due to an issue detected during an inspection this past winter. The quarterly bells continue to chime. If you take the time to stroll around the exterior of the building you will be able to see several gargoyles as well as other architectural details that add to the charm and grandeur of the building. It is situated across from Nathan Phillips Square as well as the present City Hall so it is interesting to be able to see the contrast between the old classic structure and the newer futuristic one.

reviews.title: Impressive
text: Old City Hall, was built in 1899 in the Romanesque Revival style, and took a decade to complete at a cost of $2.5 million, a full $1 million less than it took to built another Toronto gem, Casa Loma. The heritage building has great coloring with it's shades of brown sandstone as well as grey sandstone and hues of brownish red. It's attractive clock tower towers over the rest of the structure and we wished it would have been open  at the time of our visit.

reviews.title: Imposing Building
text: You can't miss the Old City hall when you are in Nathan Phillips Square. It's a look back to Toronto's past.

reviews.title: Nice Architecture
text: The building stands to represent the historic local governance of the City of Toronto. The building has been well maintained and is worth visiting. Makes for some great photos.

reviews.title: History Preserved
text: Beautiful building and it functions for traffic court as well. Close to Eaton's center Nathan Phillip's Square and many other worthwhile sights.

reviews.title: Must see
text: This is where they have the Toronto sign that lights up at night and a Beautiful fountain, there are plenty of benches to sit on. A must see at night.

reviews.title: Nice walk
text: Even when temperature is really low, it is a must go visit in Toronto. There is a lot of shopping opportunities around and very good food.

reviews.title: Very festive
text: Christmas market was very good and I enjoyed watching all the people skating on the ice rink. Plenty of great food trucks at reasonable prices.

reviews.title: Big Toronto Sign
text: I suppose this big TORONTO represents you are in the middle of a beautiful city. Hard to get a selfie without anyone in it. The City Hall was not opened on the weekend. I went on to Eaton Center where people do their shopping and pick up some nice food in the cafe.or in the food court.

reviews.title: Architecturally Beautiful
text: The Old City Hall which is now a courthouse is architecturally beautiful and a must visit for any traveler in Toronto. Could not visit inside as it was closed for Canada Day. Certainly worth a photo stop.

reviews.title: great greek food
text: You can't go wrong for greek food, plenty of fine restaurants to choose from, my fave is Astoria's on danforth. And the shopping during the day is amazing too.

reviews.title: STRIKING CONTRAST
text: Extremely picturesque building just off Nathan Philips square. Very impressive contrast to the many striking skyscrapers all around. My wife and I passed through the area whilst touring East Canada and enjoyed the sights all around.

reviews.title: worth a quick visit
text: We walked around the building which is now a court house- impressive entrance hall and staircase.but not too much to interest a visitor from UK. Usual security checks but pleasant staff.

reviews.title: The courthouse
text: This used to be the city hall before it was moved across the street to a building design I have yet to like. We toured the Old City Hall, but being an actively used courthouse, we were not allowed to take photos. As a tourist attraction, it is not a “Must See.”

reviews.title: Beautiful area
text: Came here with my wife while on tour in Toronto and there are beautiful buildings including the old city hall with its clock tower and the Toronto sign. Well worth a visit

reviews.title: photo op with Toronto sign
text: Great to stop off and get a picture in this cool space.  Always seems to be something going on.  My hotel was near by so got to walk through often. Nice open space in the middle of the city.

reviews.title: A cool historic building
text: Although it was very cold outside it was worthwhile coming to see this grand piece of Toronto's history

reviews.title: Excellent
text: Great for architecture lovers with a very interesting facade. At a busy intersection and very prominent. Do go & check it out !

reviews.title: Awesome place
text: What a neat place.  The photos outside are beautiful.  It is an active courthouse now, so no pictures inside but the outside of it is great for photos.

reviews.title: Good photo opportunity
text: I walked past the Old City Hall several times during my visit to Toronto in April 2022.  It was a great photo opportunity.  It is located near the New City Hall and the Eaton Centre.  The architecture is very interesting.

reviews.title: Beautiful architecture
text: Beautiful building. Beautiful architecture. I only saw it during the day, but I've read that it is even more beautiful at night. Can't wait to come back and confirm it by myself.

reviews.title: Historic Traditional Elegance
text: A trip to Toronto would not be complete with a visit to the iconic architecture of the seat of government, the stately  "Old"  City Hall.  Take selfies with the iconic "New" City Hall, too.

reviews.title: Great for photos
text: Coming across this castle-like building in the heart of downtown is surprisingly eye catching. Great architecture. A good spot to take some photos. The clock’s bell ring creates a great atmosphere in the neighbourhood.

reviews.title: Have to be really into architecture, but it's a cool building!
text: Really pretty during "doors open" and a great place if you like architecture, fun to take photos in front of, I don't know if they're offering the tours anymore, but kind of neat, actually.

reviews.title: Beautiful building
text: Nice to see both city halls side by side, overlooking the beautiful square. One of the most iconic places for pictures!

reviews.title: Pic opportunity
text: Not worth going out of your way, but a good photo opportunity. This 1900s building is iconic and really nice when - luckily for us - the sun broke through a wintry sky.
